title: Are all Korean music K-pop? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, not all Korean music is K-Pop. Just like any other country, they have a wide variety of music genres. They have rock bands, traditional music, r&b etc. Korea may be known for K-Pop, but it’s certainly not the only music they have. The Korean Music Scene Is More Than K-Pop
yes all korean pop music. kpop stands for korean pop music. so traditional korean music wouldn’t really be counted. Kpop is just an international music genre.
